hook.text: Your great-grandparents darned socks, patched elbows, and re-soled shoes as a matter of course.

buildup.text: Cheap clothing killed repair culture. Why fix a $10 shirt when you can just buy another one?

twist.text: Some brands fight repair. Patagonia is the rare exception, offering free repairs on their gear for life.

climax.text: The EU is pushing 'right to repair' laws for clothing, forcing brands to make fixable garments.

punchline.text: The most sustainable garment is the one you already own.
